name: Kedgeree
author: HELENUK
summary: A delicious traditional English breakfast dish using smoked white fish, rice and eggs. It is based on the Indian dish Khichri and comes from the days of the Raj.
ingredients: 4 ounces smoked haddock, or other white fish
directions: Prepare rice according to package directions
Drain, and set aside to cool
Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water
Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat
Cover and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes
Remove from hot water, cool, peel and chop
Place the haddock in a small skillet with the bay leaf
Pour in enough milk just to cover the fish
Bring to a simmer over medium heat, and cook gently until fish flakes
Remove fish from the pan, flake with a fork, and set aside
Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat
Stir in curry powder, then add the peas and onions
Fry for a couple of minutes, then add the cooked rice, eggs, and fish
Stir gently, and season with salt and pepper
Heat through, and serve with yogurt
